attributes.action: Establish a lasting memorial to honour those persons and their families who have been, and continue to be affected by the Thalidomide tragedy.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the late 1950’s and early 1960’s the Thalidomide scandal resulted in children being born without limbs, with internal injuries, with damaged eyesight and hearing and in some instances being left with severe brain damage.

The tragedy took an enormous toll on the families of these children.  

The challenges faced by the parents of Thalidomide children brought them face to face with the policy makers of the day;  resulting in better access to education, the widening of the criteria for issuing disabled parking badges and improved access to mobility equipment and everyday adaptations. 

Forty eight Thalidomide-impaired people have died.  This number excludes babies still born or who died shortly after birth.  Countless parents have also passed away still remaining unsung heroes in this story.

This petition is to request that the Prime Minister and the Government, to honour the work of Thalidomide impaired people and their families in a manner similar to the way victims of other tragedies.
